title: Metadata is not being sync‚Äôd, maybe related to --s3-decompress
body:
#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

Metadata is no longer synchronised with 1.60.0.

This works using the `-M/--metadata` parameter in 1.59.2 (see the log in the Gist below). This may be related to the `--s3-decompress` parameter which now also needs to be used and apparently had a bug regarding [metadata](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/6434).

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

```
rclone v1.60.0
- os/version: debian 11.5 (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 5.18.0-0.deb11.4-amd64 (x86_64)
- os/type: linux
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.19.2
- go/linking: static
- go/tags: none
```

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)

Debian 11, 64 Bit

#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)

Netapp StorageGrid (S3 compatible)

#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```
rclone sync -M --s3-decompress test-bucket:test-bucket-et-created/ test-bucket-et-created_post_restore
```

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (e.g. output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

https://gist.github.com/manzsolutions-lpr/a8bcad93cbf28fab531db0a83f3a1c32

* Please use the üëç [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to show that you are affected by the same issue.
* Please don't comment if you have no relevant information to add. It's just extra noise for everyone subscribed to this issue.
* Subscribe to receive notifications on status change and new comments.
